reviews.review_msg: A little TOO on top of marking. Since he asks for a boat load of written assignments it's amazing that he could possibly give a charitable or careful reading of student work.  YMMV your marks may vary.  Like someone else said, ridiculous amount of readings. Thankfully he provides some notes. Pretty uncharitable to authors, takes extreme readings.

The class itself has so much potential, but lectures did not really have a structure and the prof could not give a strong enough account of each individual paper to do them justice. Instead it was a huge amount of readings like a sprawled out dinner-rush buffet except you don't really feel satisfied at the end.

Awful Professor who plays favourites. Takes an entire semester to hand back all your work, makes the same criticizes and informs you that you failed to build off your previous work. Extremely uncharitable to the reading list. Teaching style makes everything he says unclear. Pretentious.

"I don't buy it," is his frequent yet facile quip to pretty much all continental thought, and anything contra Anglo-American moral-semanticizers who (naively) base their arguments on assumptions about the a priori "self-first" motto of human beings.  All morality is a quid quo pro, eh, Sam?  Case closed?
He is a nice and cleaver man. I liked his class a lot!!

This will sound like truism, but work hard and get on her good side. The rest is letting your work do your bidding. She will be on the lookout for errors, but don't get too upset over them because she has a pretty keen eye for them and you aren't the only one.

Hardest marker ever. Her lectures confused myself and most classmates more than actually explaining things. She assigns us very technical papers and explains absolutely nothing. The lectures have nothing to do with the readings, and then she expects us to write long papers about these topics. The midterm average was 50 per cent. AVOID.
I took Nietzsche with her and few years back and absolutely loved it.  She is very passionate about the material.  The class was great.  If it's offered again-take it.
